boiling_procedures.method_1: Salt + Baking soda in Water + Beeswax
boiling_procedures.method_3: Ashes + Salt and Baking soda in Water + Beeswax
boiling_procedures.method_4: Vibhuti + Salt and Baking soda in Water + Beeswax

safety_warning.vessel: Stainless steel only for methods 2-4 (corrosive bases eat many metals, glass)
safety_warning.protection: Use rubber gloves, have vinegar on hand (counteract acid with base)

traditional_recipe.seawater: 42g sodium chloride in 1200mL water + 30g sodium bicarbonate

kreidezeit_method.result: Partly water soluble and easy to apply

desert_grass_method.material: Yellow wax dust (cuticle dust) from desert and steppe grass
steps: Boil in saturated brine with sodium hydroxide powder
Cool white pasty wax in cold water
Purify by boiling in water containing iron oxide
Separate catalyst by boiling in water
desert_grass_method.result: White wax with high melting temperature

fritz_faiss_rediscovery.teachers: Student of Paul Klee and Wassily Kandinsky at Bauhaus
fritz_faiss_rediscovery.german_patents: Two patents on wax preparation for encaustic
fritz_faiss_rediscovery.key_finding: Boiling beeswax in sea water + soda three times raises melting point from 60°C to 100°C (140°F to 212°F)

encaustic_painting.definition: Painting with heated wax as binding medium

roman_binding_medium.authors: Cuní, Jorge & Cuni, Pedro & Eisen, Brielle & Savizky, Ruben & Bové, John (2012)
roman_binding_medium.samples: 8 Roman wall paintings from Spain + Roman-Egyptian mummy portrait
roman_binding_medium.finding: Medium composed of beeswax and soap
roman_binding_medium.conclusion: First time shown Romans used water-soluble wax-and-soap encaustic paint
roman_binding_medium.implication: Wax-and-soap may be lost ancient encaustic formulation searched for 500 years

quiz_questions.a: Saponified beeswax - beeswax boiled with salt water, baking soda, and/or ashes/potash
quiz_questions.explanation: Used by Romans for encaustic painting on walls and mummy portraits

quiz_questions.q: What did Fritz Faiss discover about Punic Wax?
quiz_questions.a: Boiling beeswax in sea water + soda three times raises melting point from 60°C to 100°C
quiz_questions.explanation: Faiss was a Bauhaus student who rediscovered the ancient technique

quiz_questions.q: What was found on the altars at the Judahite shrine of Tel Arad?
quiz_questions.a: Cannabis (THC, CBD, CBN) mixed with animal dung on smaller altar; Frankincense mixed with animal fat on larger altar
quiz_questions.explanation: 8th century BCE evidence of incense offerings in ancient Judah

quiz_questions.a: Mini-skyscrapers, ocean-faring boats, Phoenetic languages, Tyrian Purple dye, clear glass
quiz_questions.explanation: Most advanced civilization before Rome - Phoenicians = Greek Phoenix

quiz_questions.q: Who was the chief goddess of Carthage?
